Package com.project.src.expense

Class ExpenseModel

java.lang.Object
com.project.src.expense.ExpenseModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class ExpenseModel extends Object implements Serializable
MVC class representing an expense model. This class stores the details of an expense, including its name, date, category, amount, and description.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Ripamonti invalid input: '&' Luca Avveduto

  • Constructor Details

    • ExpenseModel

      public ExpenseModel(String name, LocalDate date, Categories category, float amount, String desc) throws NullPointerException, IllegalArgumentException
      Constructs an ExpenseModel with the specified details.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the expense. Must not be null or blank. The character must not be more than 10.
      date - the date of the expense. Must not be null. Must not be in the future.
      category - the category of the expense. Must not be null.
      amount - the cost of the expense. Must not be NaN or Infinite.
      desc - the description of the expense. Must not be null or blank. The character must not be more than 56.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if any of the parameters are null.
      IllegalArgumentException - if the name or description is too long or blank. If the amount is NaN or Infinite. If the date is in the future.
